item.title: AES-GCM on Different Programming Languages
item.description: The focus of this article is the result of aes-gcm encryption on python, golang, javascript, and c++. Each programming language will encryt the original text Everything has changed. It all happened for a reason. Then the encrypted text will be decryted back to original text. There's a few thing to be remembered: The size of the key is 32 bytes and the size of nonce is 12 bytes The value of key are 1-32 and the value of nonce are 1-12 Each programming language will use the same key and nonce (for convinience of this article) The result of encryption will be formated as (encrypted text + tag authentication) with base64 encoding Warning!
